item.name: Blood Thirst Armor
entries: This armor is a black suit of +1 splint mail, latticed with intricate etchings that roughly follow the lines of the major blood vessels on the body of a potential wearer.

As a bonus action, the user may 'feed' the armor blood from their veins. If they do so, the next time they take the attack action, they may roll their Hit Die (HD) and add that value to both the hit and damage of the attack. Then the value must also be subtracted from their own hitpoints.
lootTables: Shops of Barovia - Dragomir's Curio & Relic Emporium Name

entries.name: Curse
entries: The magic of the plate, while powerful, takes a massive toll on the wearer's body. With heavy use, the armor's 'veins' gradually turn the deep red of blood, and the black metal grows more lustrous, having drunk its fill. The wearer slides slowly into a state of undeath – their cheeks grow hollow, their skin grey and sallow, and their eyes sink into an abyss from which comes the gaze of the walking dead...

If the armor has not been fed in 24 hours, it consumes a HD of its own volition. The HD is lost permanently until the armor is removed. The wearer cannot stop this or remove the armor by normal means. Once the user has no HD remaining they will die.
If the user manages to remove the curse they have the opportunity to cleanse themselves of the taint. The user will regain all of the HD they sacrificed.

entries.name: History
entries: The last user was a warrior, found dead and drained of all his blood. Some say he was still moving when the armor was torn off his cold cadaver.

entries.name: Credits
entries: Art and item designed by {@link Shops of Barovia|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-LTK3X6AKprD0KM1RLYC}. Please credit if you repost elsewhere.

item.name: Helm of Whispers
entries: This ancient helm grants the user incredible knowledge from an otherworldly being. While wearing the helm the user hears faint unintelligible whispers. If the user chooses to focus on the whispers they'll receive one secret or piece of advice from the DM to help them in their current quest.
lootTables: Shops of Barovia - Dragomir's Curio & Relic Emporium Name

entries.name: Curse
entries: The being connected to this relic does not give out advice as an act of kindness. When the wearer chooses to listen to the whispers, they make a Charisma saving of DC8. This DC goes up by 1 every time the save is made. On a failed save, the being possesses the user giving it full control of the body if it chooses. While possessing the host they are also immune to charm spells.

Once in control, the being lies dormant in it's host until one of the player's allies is near death or extremely vulnerable, then it strikes. If anyone suspects or is aggressive towards the host or being, the being will attempt to murder them on the spot.
Once the player has reached 0 Hit Points, the being will leave both the body and helm, possibly to return again.

entries.name: History
entries: This helm was used by a great conquerer who seemed to predict all of his enemies next moves. Eventually he went mad and was cut down by his own son.

entries.name: Credits
entries: Art and item designed by {@link Shops of Barovia|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-LTK3X6AKprD0KM1RLYC}. Please credit if you repost elsewhere.

item.name: Sword of Light & Shadow
entries: This paradoxical weapon contains both divine and necrotic energies. On a critical hit it does an additional {@dice 2d8} necrotic damage to its target. It acts as a +1 magic longsword otherwise.
lootTables: Shops of Barovia - Dragomir's Curio & Relic Emporium Name

entries.name: Curse
entries: On a critical miss, the sword heals it's intended target by {@dice 2d8}.

entries.name: History
entries: When a sword of darkness and a sword of light were both melted down and forged into one blade, a guild of ancient dwarves hoped they were creating a weapon that could oppose both fiends and celestials alike. To their surprise, rather than emitting radiant energy, the sword emitted healing energy instead. Despite their best efforts to suppress this flaw, it still comes out from time to time.

entries.name: Credits
entries: Art and item designed by {@link Shops of Barovia|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-LTK3X6AKprD0KM1RLYC}. Please credit if you repost elsewhere.

item.name: Sacrificial Dagger
entries: Any living, humanoid creature slain by this dagger immediately rises from the dead as a {@creature Strahd Zombie|CoS|zombie thrall}. Counts as +1 dagger.
lootTables: Shops of Barovia - Dragomir's Curio & Relic Emporium Name

entries.name: Curse
entries: The zombie only is loyal to the holder of the dagger. It will always attack the closest living creature within 30ft.

entries.name: History
entries: Once belonging to the famous necromancer Wiz-jak, this dagger has seen it's fair share of sacrifices. With enough time and fresh bodies, one could create any entire army.

entries.name: Credits
entries: Art and item designed by {@link Shops of Barovia|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-LTK3X6AKprD0KM1RLYC}. Please credit if you repost elsewhere.

item.name: Venom Quiver
entries: This magic quiver enchants any bolts or arrows that are stored inside of it, giving the missiles an extra {@dice 1d6} poison damage.
lootTables: Shops of Barovia - Dragomir's Curio & Relic Emporium Name

entries.name: Curse
entries: Being a magic item of poor make, the quiver will accidentally turn the entire quiver of arrows into a Swarm of Poisonous Snakes when the wielder rolls a natural 1 on attack. The transformation takes place before the missile is fired and the snake will attack the user or next closest creature on that same turn.

entries.name: History
entries: The magic quiver was the product of a careless mage. Hoping to have an infinite supply of poison tipped arrows, he imbued the quiver with magic snake venom. Unfortunately, he used the improper balance of components which caused the quiver to have an unfortunate quirk.

entries.name: Credits
entries: Art and item designed by {@link Shops of Barovia|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-LTK3X6AKprD0KM1RLYC}. Please credit if you repost elsewhere.

item.name: Cloak of Undeath
entries: The cloak cannot be removed without a Remove Curse spell. While wearing it the player is immune to healing and resurrection spells and potions. They are also vulnerable to radiant damage. If the user falls dead while wearing this cloak they are instantly resurrected as a mindless {@creature Strahd Zombie|CoS|zombie}.
lootTables: Shops of Barovia - Dragomir's Curio & Relic Emporium Name

entries.name: Curse
entries: The cloak cannot be removed without a Remove Curse spell. While wearing it the player is immune to healing and resurrection spells and potions. They are also vulnerable to radiant damage. If the user falls dead while wearing this cloak they are instantly resurrected as a mindless {@creature Strahd Zombie|CoS|zombie}.

entries.name: History
entries: This cloak was made by a group of necromancers seeking immortality. In a way, they had found it, but in the end they all became crippled husks of their former selves.

entries.name: Credits
entries: Art and item designed by {@link Shops of Barovia|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-LTK3X6AKprD0KM1RLYC}. Please credit if you repost elsewhere.

item.name: Gloves of Pilfering
entries: These leather gloves feel nearly as soft as silk The wearer of these gloves has advantage on all sleight of hand rolls.
lootTables: Shops of Barovia - Dragomir's Curio & Relic Emporium Name

entries.name: Curse
entries: Once per day the gloves take on a mind of their own, forcing the user to make an attempt to steal an item within reach. The item's owner must be a creature that is unaware of the gloves true nature.

entries.name: History
entries: These gloves were imbued with the soul of a great thief. The creator of the gloves realized he underestimated the thief 's love for stealing however, when he saw that the gloves started acting on their own.

entries.name: Credits
entries: Art and item designed by {@link Shops of Barovia|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-LTK3X6AKprD0KM1RLYC}. Please credit if you repost elsewhere.

item.name: Necklace of Tongues
entries: This necklace is made of a thin leather cord adorned a variety of embalmed tongues. The wearer of this necklace can speak any language of intelligent creatures
lootTables: Shops of Barovia - Dragomir's Curio & Relic Emporium Name

entries.name: Curse
entries: Roll {@dice 1d6} whenever this is attempted. On a 1-2, the user wildly misunderstands what is being said or their responses are exceptionally offensive.

entries.name: History
entries: The many tongues from this necklace come from each creature whose language it's wearer can now speak.

entries.name: Credits
entries: Art and item designed by {@link Shops of Barovia|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-LTK3X6AKprD0KM1RLYC}. Please credit if you repost elsewhere.

item.name: Ring of Borrowed Time
entries: This ring allows the users to go briefly back in time and correct past mistakes. Once per day, whenever you make an attack roll, an ability check, or a saving throw, you can use the ring to re-roll the dice even after the result has been determined.
lootTables: Shops of Barovia - Dragomir's Curio & Relic Emporium Name

entries.name: Curse
entries: The time this ring grants the user must eventually be paid back a million fold. Every time it's used, the user ages years depending on their race in the table below:

entries.name: History
entries: A dying wizard created this ring in order to extend her life before succumbing to a rapidly growing illness. In the end she only managed to save seconds of her life rather than the years she hoped for.

entries.name: Credits
entries: Art and item designed by {@link Shops of Barovia|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-LTK3X6AKprD0KM1RLYC}. Please credit if you repost elsewhere.

item.name: Unbind Curse Scroll
entries: A overlypriced scroll of Unbind Curse for remove curse if anyone is cursed by one of Shop barovian items.
lootTables: Shops of Barovia - Dragomir's Curio & Relic Emporium Name

entries.name: Credits
entries: Art and item designed by {@link Shops of Barovia|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-LTK3X6AKprD0KM1RLYC}. Please credit if you repost elsewhere.

item.name: Dragomir's Grab Bag
entries: Dragomir has a huge assortment of cursed items and relics. Most of them, however, are fairly mundane and would not do be a great boon or bane to the player. He has been unable to sell these trinkets so tries to get rid of them for a paltry fee. When picking an item out of the bag, the buyer must take the first item they touch.

To see what item the player receives, have both the DM and the player roll a d20. If the DM rolls 1-10, give the player a cursed item matching his roll. If the DM rolls 11-20, give the player a curio matching his roll.
They should not know which type of item they received. Any equipped trinkets cannot be removed.
Cursed

rows: The user skin becomes a porcelain white.
Your heart beat is no longer detectable, for all you know it has stopped beating.
The flesh around the ring dies, but remains functional. This effect spreads very slowly.
Your hair turns a silvery white when combed.
After touching the spoon, all food now tastes like hot borscht.
You can now see dark spirits hovering over people who are about to die from age and illness.
Ghosts are now attracted towards your presence when nearby
Your shadow now takes a life of it's own when no-one else is looking.
Womens and girls no longer trust you.
A small shadowfell creature only you can see follows you around.
You can escape into mirrors, but your reflection there will try to kill you.
The more cruel deeds you commit the more your appearance becomes devil like
You gain terrible visions of the future, but unknown to you, they're always wrong.
You start sleep walking, doing bizarre things in the night
You no longer need to eat. If you try to, you immediately vomit.
You gain resistance from cold but vulnerability to fire.
If pinned on one's clothing, it turns their whole outfit monochromatic.
Your character will occasionally be shifted into the distant past or far future for several seconds.
A creepy doll whose eyes follow you. If thrown away it shows up again the next day.

entries: Curios

rows: Your eyes turn to cats eyes. You gain darkvision.
You can sense heartbeats within 30ft, but not their direction.
You can use this needle to stitch on a dead limb to replace one of your own, giving it life.
When angry, your eyes turn blood red, giving +1 to intimidation.
Each round in combat you steal 1 life from any ally or creature within 5ft
You gain 10ft of extra movement in darkness
You have advantage when making arcana checks about necromancy
You can make shadow puppets that come alive, but are always just shadows.
You do double damage to werewolves but they also do double to you.
You can now eat rotten meat and not get sick.
You can sense when undead are beneath your feat.
You can see invisible creatures, but only behind you in the mirror.
Your blood is now poison, if a creature bites you, do 1d4 damage.
Once per day you can become ethereal for 6 seconds.
You critically hit on 19-20. But something extra awful happens on critical miss
Gives you +2 persuasion against women but also attracts wolves.
50% chance of doubling or nullifying any drinks potency.
Bewitches an inanimate object 3 times for day, but they don't obey commands
Summons a skeleton cat familiar. If the cat is destroyed so is the skull.
Summons a swarm of rats (3 charges). 25% chance they turn on their attacker

lootTables: Shops of Barovia - Dragomir's Curio & Relic Emporium Name

entries.name: Credits
entries: Art and item designed by {@link Shops of Barovia|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-LTK3X6AKprD0KM1RLYC}. Please credit if you repost elsewhere.

item.name: Bottle
entries: Classic bootle of varius types
lootTables: Shops of Barovia - Serpent's Kiss

entries.name: Credits
entries: Art and item designed by {@link Shops of Barovia|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-LTK3X6AKprD0KM1RLYC}. Please credit if you repost elsewhere.

item.name: Glass
entries: Classic glass of varius types
lootTables: Shops of Barovia - Serpent's Kiss

entries.name: Credits
entries: Art and item designed by {@link Shops of Barovia|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-LTK3X6AKprD0KM1RLYC}. Please credit if you repost elsewhere.

item.name: Potion Alchemists Fire
entries: Potion with spell alchemist's fire

This sticky, adhesive fluid ignites when exposed to air. As an action, you can throw this flask up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. Make a ranged Attack against a creature or object, treating the alchemist's fire as an Improvised Weapon. On a hit, the target takes 1d4 fire damage at the start of each of its turns. A creature can end this damage by using its action to make a DC 10 Dexterity check to extinguish the flames.
lootTables: Shops of Barovia - Serpent's Kiss

entries.name: Credits
entries: Art and item designed by {@link Shops of Barovia|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-LTK3X6AKprD0KM1RLYC}. Please credit if you repost elsewhere.

item.name: Potion Entagling Sap
entries: When breaking after being thrown, this jar creates a 20 foot square of sticky sap for 1 minute. The area is considered difficult terrain.

If a creature is standing in the splashed area it must pass a Strength save of 13 or be restrained. A restrained creature can release itself by using its action to attempt another Strength save, being freed on a success.
lootTables: Shops of Barovia - Serpent's Kiss

entries.name: Credits
entries: Art and item designed by {@link Shops of Barovia|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-LTK3X6AKprD0KM1RLYC}. Please credit if you repost elsewhere.

item.name: Potion of Unclouded Thought
entries: After drinking, for 1 hour the player can perfectly remember anything in their memory. They also get +10 to history, religion, and arcane checks.
lootTables: Shops of Barovia - Serpent's Kiss

entries.name: Credits
entries: Art and item designed by {@link Shops of Barovia|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-LTK3X6AKprD0KM1RLYC}. Please credit if you repost elsewhere.

item.name: Potion of Cure Disease
entries: Cures all diseases that the subject is suffering from. The spell also kills parasites, including green slime and others. Certain special diseases may not be countered by this spell or may be countered only by a caster of a certain level or higher.
{@note * Since the spell's duration is instantaneous, it does not prevent reinfection after a new exposure to the same disease at a later date}.
lootTables: Shops of Barovia - Serpent's Kiss

entries.name: Credits
entries: Art and item designed by {@link Shops of Barovia|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-LTK3X6AKprD0KM1RLYC}. Please credit if you repost elsewhere.

item.name: Potion of Cure Poison
entries: You are cured from the {@condition poisoned} condition and have immunity to poison damage for a couple of hours.
lootTables: Shops of Barovia - Serpent's Kiss

entries.name: Credits
entries: Art and item designed by {@link Shops of Barovia|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-LTK3X6AKprD0KM1RLYC}. Please credit if you repost elsewhere.

item.name: Potion Eternal Youth
entries: Temporarily reduces the players age by one span per dose for one week.
lootTables: Shops of Barovia - Serpent's Kiss

entries.name: Credits
entries: Art and item designed by {@link Shops of Barovia|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-LTK3X6AKprD0KM1RLYC}. Please credit if you repost elsewhere.

item.name: Potion Beard-gro
entries: Grows an instant beard when poured on one's chin. Will grow hair anywhere really
lootTables: Shops of Barovia - Serpent's Kiss

entries.name: Credits
entries: Art and item designed by {@link Shops of Barovia|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-LTK3X6AKprD0KM1RLYC}. Please credit if you repost elsewhere.

item.name: Potion Night Mother's Kiss
entries: When thrown, deals {@dice 2d6} cold damage and freezes the enemy in place, preventing movement. A DC13 strength check is needed to break free.
lootTables: Shops of Barovia - Serpent's Kiss

entries.name: Credits
entries: Art and item designed by {@link Shops of Barovia|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-LTK3X6AKprD0KM1RLYC}. Please credit if you repost elsewhere.

item.name: Potion Love Tonic
entries: The drinker of this potion must make a DC10 charisma saving throw or they will fall in love (charmed) with the next person they see for 1 hour.
lootTables: Shops of Barovia - Serpent's Kiss

entries.name: Credits
entries: Art and item designed by {@link Shops of Barovia|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-LTK3X6AKprD0KM1RLYC}. Please credit if you repost elsewhere.

item.name: Potion Deadman's Draught
entries: The drinker will become cold and clammy with a slight rotten odor after drinking this potion. Creatures will have to make a perception check DC13 to know you're still alive. Undead with intelligence under 8 ignore you for 1 hour.
lootTables: Shops of Barovia - Serpent's Kiss

entries.name: Credits
entries: Art and item designed by {@link Shops of Barovia|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-LTK3X6AKprD0KM1RLYC}. Please credit if you repost elsewhere.

item.name: Stinging Icor
entries: A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw, taking 10 (2d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
lootTables: Shops of Barovia - Serpent's Kiss

entries.name: Credits
entries: Art and item designed by {@link Shops of Barovia|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-LTK3X6AKprD0KM1RLYC}. Please credit if you repost elsewhere.

item.name: Black-cap poison
entries: This poison is typically made only by the {@creature drow}, and only in a place far removed from sunlight. A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 hour. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature is also {@condition unconscious} while {@condition poisoned} in this way. The creature wakes up if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it awake.
{@note * This item group has the same name and source as the item {@item Drow Poison}}.
lootTables: Shops of Barovia - Serpent's Kiss

entries.name: Credits
entries: Art and item designed by {@link Shops of Barovia|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-LTK3X6AKprD0KM1RLYC}. Please credit if you repost elsewhere.

item.name: Silver Morninglord Talisman
entries: These talismans have much less power than people believe. However, due to it's silver material, it can burn the flesh of any shape changer it's pressed against, providing an effective torture weapon.
lootTables: Shops of Barovia - Monster Hunter's Guild

entries.name: Credits
entries: Art and item designed by {@link Shops of Barovia|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-LTK3X6AKprD0KM1RLYC}. Please credit if you repost elsewhere.

item.name: Sunlight Reliquary
entries: The church has found an ingenious way to slowly trap sunlight in this reliquary. When opened, weeks of captured sunlight comes pouring out, doing 1d6 radiant damage in a 15ft cone. The reliquary may be recharged by sitting out in sunlight. For every day its left in the sun, it does an extra {@dice 1d6} up to a total of {@dice 3d6}.
lootTables: Shops of Barovia - Monster Hunter's Guild

entries.name: Credits
entries: Art and item designed by {@link Shops of Barovia|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-LTK3X6AKprD0KM1RLYC}. Please credit if you repost elsewhere.

item.name: Barbed Net
entries: This barbed net can restrain solid, large creatures or smaller and make a {@dice 1d10} piercing damage. A creature can use a bonus action to make a DC 10 Strength check, freeing itself or another creature within its reach on a success. Unlike normal nets, a barbed net deals more damage the more a user struggles. For every attempt made, the creature also takes 2 damage. Dealing 5 slashing damage to the net (AC 10) also frees the creature without harming it, ending the effect and destroying the net.
lootTables: Shops of Barovia - Monster Hunter's Guild

entries.name: Credits
entries: Art and item designed by {@link Shops of Barovia|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-LTK3X6AKprD0KM1RLYC}. Please credit if you repost elsewhere.

item.name: Bear Trap
entries: When you use your action to set it, this trap forms a sawtoothed steel ring that snaps shut when a creature steps on a pressure plate in the center. The trap is affixed by a heavy chain to an immobile object, such as a tree or a spike driven into the ground. A creature that steps on the plate must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or take {@dice 1d6} piercing damage and stop moving. Thereafter, until the creature breaks free of the trap, its Movement is limited by the length of the chain (typically 3 feet long). A creature can use its action to make a DC 13 Strength check, freeing itself or another creature within its reach on a success. Each failed check deals {@dice 1d1} piercing damage to the trapped creature.
lootTables: Shops of Barovia - Monster Hunter's Guild

entries.name: Credits
entries: Art and item designed by {@link Shops of Barovia|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-LTK3X6AKprD0KM1RLYC}. Please credit if you repost elsewhere.

item.name: Garlic Braid
entries: A Garlic Braid
lootTables: Shops of Barovia - Monster Hunter's Guild

entries.name: Credits
entries: Art and item designed by {@link Shops of Barovia|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-LTK3X6AKprD0KM1RLYC}. Please credit if you repost elsewhere.

item.name: Burning Blade Oil
entries: This especially viscous liquid can be lit on fire without running off a blade. If a user applies the oil to his weapon and lights it, the weapon will be granted an additional {@dice 1d6} burning damage for 1 minute. This cannot be combined with other elemental effects.
lootTables: Shops of Barovia - Monster Hunter's Guild

entries.name: Credits
entries: Art and item designed by {@link Shops of Barovia|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-LTK3X6AKprD0KM1RLYC}. Please credit if you repost elsewhere.

item.name: Holy Incense
entries: This swinging censer provides divine protection to anyone who breathes in it's fumes. If the attacker is a fiend or undead, it takes {@dice 1d6} radiant damage.
lootTables: Shops of Barovia - Monster Hunter's Guild

entries.name: Credits
entries: Art and item designed by {@link Shops of Barovia|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-LTK3X6AKprD0KM1RLYC}. Please credit if you repost elsewhere.

item.name: Censer of the Faithful
entries: This swinging censer provides divine protection to anyone who breathes in it's fumes. After lighting incense and standing near within 10ft of censer for 1 minute, all creatures gain +1d4 on all skill checks for the next hour. Every time this item is used it consumes on incense which can be purchased from any appropriate church for 5gp. However, they may eventually run out of supplies.
lootTables: Shops of Barovia - Monster Hunter's Guild

entries.name: Credits
entries: Art and item designed by {@link Shops of Barovia|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-LTK3X6AKprD0KM1RLYC}. Please credit if you repost elsewhere.

item.name: Silver Spear
entries: A spear of pure silver. Silver weapons hurt certain creatures vulnerable to the metal.
This weapon is otherwise treated as a +1 magic spear.
lootTables: Shops of Barovia - Monster Hunter's Guild

entries.name: Credits
entries: Art and item designed by {@link Shops of Barovia|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-LTK3X6AKprD0KM1RLYC}. Please credit if you repost elsewhere.

item.name: Silver Longsword
entries: A longsword of pure silver. Silver weapons hurt certain creatures vulnerable to the metal.
This weapon is otherwise treated as a +1 magic longsword.
lootTables: Shops of Barovia - Monster Hunter's Guild

entries.name: Credits
entries: Art and item designed by {@link Shops of Barovia|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-LTK3X6AKprD0KM1RLYC}. Please credit if you repost elsewhere.

item.name: Silver Mace
entries: A mace of pure silver. Silver weapons hurt certain creatures vulnerable to the metal.
This weapon is otherwise treated as a +1 magic mace.
lootTables: Shops of Barovia - Monster Hunter's Guild

entries.name: Credits
entries: Art and item designed by {@link Shops of Barovia|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-LTK3X6AKprD0KM1RLYC}. Please credit if you repost elsewhere.

item.name: Brand of Repentance (rod)
entries: This branding iron, ending in the holy symbol of the morning lord was once used to torture suspected werewolves, witches, and vampires into submitting their guilt. By yelling the word "Repent!" the end of the brand will turn white hot. The weapon can then be pressed against a foe for {@dice 1d6} fire damage, branding them with the holy mark. A creature scarred with the mark has the effect of a Zone-of-truth spell on them.
This weapon is otherwise treated as a +1 magic quarterstaff.
lootTables: Shops of Barovia - Monster Hunter's Guild

entries.name: Credits
entries: Art and item designed by {@link Shops of Barovia|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-LTK3X6AKprD0KM1RLYC}. Please credit if you repost elsewhere.

item.name: Morninglord's Grasp (whip)
entries: This ivory handled whip has the ability to ensnare and burn it's enemies. When you hit with an attack you may use your bonus action to attempt to ensnare the target or pull them prone (but not both), using your weapon attack modifier in place of Strength (Athletics). A ensnared target may not move or use the ensnared arm and takes {@dice 1d10} fire damage each turn until free. If you make a second attack while grappling a target, they will be let released.
This weapon is otherwise treated as a +1 magic whip.
lootTables: Shops of Barovia - Monster Hunter's Guild

entries.name: Credits
entries: Art and item designed by {@link Shops of Barovia|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-LTK3X6AKprD0KM1RLYC}. Please credit if you repost elsewhere.

item.name: Silver Dagger
entries: A dagger of pure silver with  +1 of Throwing Daggers. Silver weapons hurt certain creatures vulnerable to the metal.
This weapon is otherwise treated as a +1 magic dagger.
lootTables: Shops of Barovia - Monster Hunter's Guild

entries.name: Credits
entries: Art and item designed by {@link Shops of Barovia|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-LTK3X6AKprD0KM1RLYC}. Please credit if you repost elsewhere.

item.name: Short-Bow of the Hound
entries: This magic bow was crafted for hunting and staking elusive prey. After drawing an arrow onto the bow, one simply has to whisper "follow" in elven and the next arrow that strikes true marks the target. For the next 24 hours the bow will always point towards the target when laid on the ground.
This weapon is otherwise treated as a +1 magic shortbow.
lootTables: Shops of Barovia - Monster Hunter's Guild

entries.name: Credits
entries: Art and item designed by {@link Shops of Barovia|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-LTK3X6AKprD0KM1RLYC}. Please credit if you repost elsewhere.

item.name: Silver Arrows x10
entries: A pack of silver arrows of pure silver. Silver weapons hurt certain creatures vulnerable to the metal.
This weapon is otherwise treated as a +1 magic arrow.
lootTables: Shops of Barovia - Monster Hunter's Guild

entries.name: Credits
entries: Art and item designed by {@link Shops of Barovia|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-LTK3X6AKprD0KM1RLYC}. Please credit if you repost elsewhere.

item.name: Silver Bolts x10
entries: A pack of silver bolts of pure silver. Silver weapons hurt certain creatures vulnerable to the metal.
This weapon is otherwise treated as a +1 magic bolt.
lootTables: Shops of Barovia - Monster Hunter's Guild

entries.name: Credits
entries: Art and item designed by {@link Shops of Barovia|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-LTK3X6AKprD0KM1RLYC}. Please credit if you repost elsewhere.

item.name: Sacred Oak Arrows x10
entries: A pack of silver arrows of pure silver. Silver weapons hurt certain creatures vulnerable to the metal.
Sacred oak weapons do critical damage on natural rolls of 18-20 when fighting vampires.
This weapon is otherwise treated as a +1 magic arrow.
lootTables: Shops of Barovia - Monster Hunter's Guild

entries.name: Credits
entries: Art and item designed by {@link Shops of Barovia|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-LTK3X6AKprD0KM1RLYC}. Please credit if you repost elsewhere.

item.name: Sacred Oak Bolts x10
entries: A pack of silver bolts of pure silver. Silver weapons hurt certain creatures vulnerable to the metal.
Sacred oak weapons do critical damage on natural rolls of 18-20 when fighting vampires.
This weapon is otherwise treated as a +1 magic bolt.
lootTables: Shops of Barovia - Monster Hunter's Guild

entries.name: Credits
entries: Art and item designed by {@link Shops of Barovia|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-LTK3X6AKprD0KM1RLYC}. Please credit if you repost elsewhere.

item.name: Hemlock Ring
entries: A Magic Jewelery. Allows the user to cast the {@spell poison spray|phb} cantrip at level 1. Requires attunement.
lootTables: Shops of Barovia - The Blind Witch

entries.name: Credits
entries: Art and item designed by {@link Shops of Barovia|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-LTK3X6AKprD0KM1RLYC}. Please credit if you repost elsewhere.

item.name: Talisman of the Mad Druid
entries: A Magic Jewelery. Enchanted by a mad druid, this wooden talisman allows the user to shape change once a day. Unfortunately he never gave the user the ability to control WHICH kind of animal. Have the user roll a {@dice 1d100}, where 1 is an beetle and 100 is a brown bear, to determine the size of the creature. The creature has to be a beast and cannot exceed a challenge rating of 1. While transformed, the user follows the wild shape rules, but must stay in the form for at least 1 minute.
lootTables: Shops of Barovia - The Blind Witch

entries.name: Credits
entries: Art and item designed by {@link Shops of Barovia|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-LTK3X6AKprD0KM1RLYC}. Please credit if you repost elsewhere.

item.name: Ring of the Phoenix
entries: A Magic Jewelery. This magnificent is set with a glowing stone that swirls internally with fire. If the wearer fails all 3 saving throws the stone will will return it's master back to life with full hit points. During this moment fire will swirl and surround the ring bearer, causing {@dice 2d6} fire damage to everyone in 5 feet. Once used the ring's magic fades forever. Uses attunement.

Alternatve Version: This magnificent is set with 3 glowing magical stones. If the user is reduced to 0 hit points one of the stones will be spent and the user will return back to life with 1 hit point. During this moment fire will swirl and surround the ring bearer, causing {@dice 2d6} fire damage to everyone in 5 feet. After being saved 3 times the ring's magic fades forever.
lootTables: Shops of Barovia - The Blind Witch

entries.name: Credits
entries: Art and item designed by {@link Shops of Barovia|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-LTK3X6AKprD0KM1RLYC}. Please credit if you repost elsewhere.

item.name: Bracers of Bugbear Strength
entries: A Magic Jewelery. While wearing these bracers, your Strength score changes to 16. If your Strength is already equal to or greater than the bracers' score, the item has no effect on you. Requires attunement.
lootTables: Shops of Barovia - The Blind Witch

entries.name: Credits
entries: Art and item designed by {@link Shops of Barovia|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-LTK3X6AKprD0KM1RLYC}. Please credit if you repost elsewhere.

item.name: Necromancer's Robes
entries: A clothing. These black tattered robes give the user +1 to all of their Necromancy spell Difficulty Checks. It also provides {@dice 1d1} damage resistance against all spell damage. Requires attunement.
lootTables: Shops of Barovia - The Blind Witch

entries.name: Credits
entries: Art and item designed by {@link Shops of Barovia|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-LTK3X6AKprD0KM1RLYC}. Please credit if you repost elsewhere.

item.name: Fey Guard Robes
entries: A clothing. These brightly colored robes seem impossibly light. Enchanted by the fey, they protect the user from being struck down in battle. Once per day as a reaction from being attacked, the user may invoke the robes and be sent randomly in any direction as if they used the Misty Step spell. Use a {@dice 1d8} to determine the direction going clockwise. The robes will always move the wearer the full 30ft if possible. When using their reaction, it must be after the attack is delcared but before the result it's success determined. Requires attunement.
lootTables: Shops of Barovia - The Blind Witch

entries.name: Credits
entries: Art and item designed by {@link Shops of Barovia|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-LTK3X6AKprD0KM1RLYC}. Please credit if you repost elsewhere.

item.name: Vistani's Shroud
entries: A clothing. This weathered fur coat is more magical that it would first seem. Used by enemies of the Vistani, this cloak protects the wearer from divination and scrying that target them. While the cloak is on, they cannot be seen by magical means and their fortunes cannot be told.
lootTables: Shops of Barovia - The Blind Witch

entries.name: Credits
entries: Art and item designed by {@link Shops of Barovia|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-LTK3X6AKprD0KM1RLYC}. Please credit if you repost elsewhere.

item.name: Magic Compass
entries: A Wonderous Items. Sitting in a decorated case, this compass comes with a small stone companion. When one separates the two, the compass will always point to the stone. If there are obstacles between the compass and the stone, the compass will point to the path that leads around them.
lootTables: Shops of Barovia - The Blind Witch

entries.name: Credits
entries: Art and item designed by {@link Shops of Barovia|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-LTK3X6AKprD0KM1RLYC}. Please credit if you repost elsewhere.

item.name: Sending Stone XS
entries: A Wonderous Items. Sending stones always come in sets. These two are smooth and delicately carved to match each other, so the pairs were easily recognizable. While two separate people carry the stones they can freely use the Sending Spell towards any other creature carrying another sending stone.
XS - Extra-planar range
8 Plus - Single Planar range
lootTables: Shops of Barovia - The Blind Witch

entries.name: Credits
entries: Art and item designed by {@link Shops of Barovia|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-LTK3X6AKprD0KM1RLYC}. Please credit if you repost elsewhere.

item.name: Sending Stone 8 Plus
entries: A Wonderous Items. Sending stones always come in sets. These two are smooth and delicately carved to match each other, so the pairs were easily recognizable. While two separate people carry the stones they can freely use the Sending Spell towards any other creature carrying another sending stone.
XS - Extra-planar range
8 Plus - Single Planar range
lootTables: Shops of Barovia - The Blind Witch

entries.name: Credits
entries: Art and item designed by {@link Shops of Barovia|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-LTK3X6AKprD0KM1RLYC}. Please credit if you repost elsewhere.

item.name: Alchemist's Jug
entries: A Wonderous Items. This ceramic jug appears to be able to hold a gallon of liquid and weighs 12 pounds whether full or empty. Sloshing sounds can be heard from within the jug when it is shaken, even if the jug is empty.

You can use an action and name one liquid from the table below to cause the jug to produce the chosen liquid. Afterward, you can uncork the jug as an action and pour that liquid out, up to 2 gallons per minute. The maximum amount of liquid the jug can produce depends on the liquid you named.
Once the jug starts producing a liquid, it can't produce a different one, or more of one that has reached its maximum, until the next dawn.
{@note * This item group has the same name and source as the item {@item alchemist's jug|dmg}}.
lootTables: Shops of Barovia - The Blind Witch

entries.name: Credits
entries: Art and item designed by {@link Shops of Barovia|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-LTK3X6AKprD0KM1RLYC}. Please credit if you repost elsewhere.

item.name: Bigby's Bag of Destiny
entries: A Wonderous Items. This one use item allows the user to pull a mysterious item out of the bag. The item will be whatever the user most needs at that particular moment in time. Once an item is drawn or if someone looks into the bag, it will never produce another item. The DM decides what the item will be at the time.
lootTables: Shops of Barovia - The Blind Witch

entries.name: Credits
entries: Art and item designed by {@link Shops of Barovia|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-LTK3X6AKprD0KM1RLYC}. Please credit if you repost elsewhere.

item.name: Duelist's Vest
entries: This finely crafted leather vest was made to protect the wearer during a fencing duel. On top of the protection a typical leather vest provides, this suit is reinforced against piercing attacks. All piercing damage is reduce by 2.
lootTables: Shops of Barovia - Jablonski & Sons

entries.name: Credits
entries: Art and item designed by {@link Shops of Barovia|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-LTK3X6AKprD0KM1RLYC}. Please credit if you repost elsewhere.

item.name: Autumn's Shadow
entries: Once known as the Cloak of Four Seasons. This magic armor was used by elves on their hunts to blend in with the changing colors of the seasons. Sadly in Barovia's constant darkness, these leaves always look dead and rotting. When sneaking or hiding among plants or trees this armor grants it's user advantage on all stealth rolls.
lootTables: Shops of Barovia - Jablonski & Sons

entries.name: Credits
entries: Art and item designed by {@link Shops of Barovia|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-LTK3X6AKprD0KM1RLYC}. Please credit if you repost elsewhere.

item.name: Terminus Est
entries: A sharp, intimidating sword, this blade once served as a symbol of authority for executioners. The mercury in it's core makes it light to raise and heavy to swing downward, perfect for beheadings. When attacking a prone target, this sword always does critical damage on a successful hit. In addition, this weapon has the stats of a +1 greatsword.
lootTables: Shops of Barovia - Bloodbath & Beyond

entries.name: Credits
entries: Art and item designed by {@link Shops of Barovia|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-LTK3X6AKprD0KM1RLYC}. Please credit if you repost elsewhere.

item.name: Geist Bane
entries: This phantom blade is caught between the material and ethereal plane. While the handle remains in this realm, the blade glows an ethereal blue and is semi-transparent. Because of it's semi-permeable nature, this weapon can pass through enemies and damage them at the same time.

As a bonus action, when attacking with this weapon you may attempt to roll to hit an additional target as long as they are within 5ft of both you and the attacker. You may repeat this on another additional target as long as every previous hit is successful and they are within 5ft of you.
This weapon is also a +1 magic weapon and does an extra {@damage 2d6} damage to ghost-type enemies.
lootTables: Shops of Barovia - Bloodbath & Beyond

entries.name: Credits
entries: Art and item designed by {@link Shops of Barovia|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-LTK3X6AKprD0KM1RLYC}. Please credit if you repost elsewhere.

item.name: Dousing Blade
entries: This odd sword is made of a peculiar metal that takes on the properties of any blood it comes in contact with. Any time a creature is struck with a slashing or piercing attack, the blade will absorb the properties of that creature, if acceptable. It will never inherit properties that make it weaker and it can only take on one property at a time. As soon as a new compatible source comes in contact with it, it will change. The table below are some examples of fusions.
lootTables: Shops of Barovia - Bloodbath & Beyond

entries.name: Credits
entries: Art and item designed by {@link Shops of Barovia|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-LTK3X6AKprD0KM1RLYC}. Please credit if you repost elsewhere.

item.name: Smoke Bomb
entries: As an action, a character can light this bomb and throw it at a point up to 60 feet away. Each creature within 20 feet of that point.
This grenade begins to emit a large cloud of thick smoke in a 20ft radius. Anyone inside the smoke suffers the effect of {@condition blinded} without the blind-sense ability.
lootTables: Shops of Barovia - Fritz Von Weerg's Workshop

entries.name: Credits
entries: Art and item designed by {@link Shops of Barovia|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-LTK3X6AKprD0KM1RLYC}. Please credit if you repost elsewhere.

item.name: Rending Bomb
entries: As an action, a character can light this bomb and throw it at a point up to 60 feet away. Each creature within 10 feet of that point must succeed on a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 6d6} piercing damage.

This brutal explosive maims it's victims by showering them with metal shrapnel. Anyone caught in the 10ft radius blast takes {@damage 6d6} piercing damage on a failed Dex save (DC12). Those who pass take only half damage.
lootTables: Shops of Barovia - Fritz Von Weerg's Workshop

entries.name: Credits
entries: Art and item designed by {@link Shops of Barovia|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-LTK3X6AKprD0KM1RLYC}. Please credit if you repost elsewhere.

item.name: Sunburst Bomb
entries: As an action, a character can light this bomb and throw it at a point up to 60 feet away. Anyone caught in the 20ft radius blast takes {@damage 6d6} piercing damage on a failed Con save (DC12). Those who pass take only half damage.

Loaded with flashing powder, when this grenade goes off, all creatures in a 20ft radius are inflicted with blindness on a failed Con save (DC12). For every turn there after the creature may attempt to reroll the save. After detonation, this grenade gives off the effects of the Light spell for 1 round.
lootTables: Shops of Barovia - Fritz Von Weerg's Workshop

entries.name: Credits
entries: Art and item designed by {@link Shops of Barovia|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-LTK3X6AKprD0KM1RLYC}. Please credit if you repost elsewhere.

item.name: Angry Ratkin
entries: Packed with explosive powder, this little wind up toy mouse can travel up to 100 feet before going off. Anyone caught in the 10ft radius blast takes {@damage 4d6} blunt damage on a failed Dex save (DC12). The user has full control of the distance traveled, but it can only move in a straight line.
lootTables: Shops of Barovia - Fritz Von Weerg's Workshop

entries.name: Credits
entries: Art and item designed by {@link Shops of Barovia|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-LTK3X6AKprD0KM1RLYC}. Please credit if you repost elsewhere.

item.name: Blast Hook (w/3 caps)
entries: This explosive powered grappling hook is Popov's most genius invention. Upon firing, it allows the user to hook a rope on to any surface up to 30ft away. Given the power of the firing mechanism it can pierce through most surfaces and even deals 1d8 piercing damage if hitting a creature.

Given its light weight design, this device can be used as bonus action or a reaction. The only short-fall is that each shot requires a blast cap to fire. The initial item comes with 3 and more can be purchased.
lootTables: Shops of Barovia - Fritz Von Weerg's Workshop

entries.name: Credits
entries: Art and item designed by {@link Shops of Barovia|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-LTK3X6AKprD0KM1RLYC}. Please credit if you repost elsewhere.

item.name: Eyes of the Bat
entries: While wearing these dark lenses, you have Darkvision out to a range of 60 feet. If you already have Darkvision. wearing the goggles increases its range by 60 feet.
lootTables: Shops of Barovia - Fritz Von Weerg's Workshop

entries.name: Credits
entries: Art and item designed by {@link Shops of Barovia|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-LTK3X6AKprD0KM1RLYC}. Please credit if you repost elsewhere.

item.name: Eyes of the Owl
entries: These Crystal lenses fit over the eyes. While wearing them, you can see much better than normal out to a range of 1 foot. You have advantage on Investigation checks that rely on sight while searching an area or studying an object within that range.
lootTables: Shops of Barovia - Fritz Von Weerg's Workshop

entries.name: Credits
entries: Art and item designed by {@link Shops of Barovia|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-LTK3X6AKprD0KM1RLYC}. Please credit if you repost elsewhere.

table.name: Dragomir's Grab Bag; Cursed
intro: Dragomir has a huge assortment of cursed items and relics. Most of them, however, are fairly mundane and would not do be a great boon or bane to the player. He has been unable to sell these trinkets so tries to get rid of them for a paltry fee. When picking an item out of the bag, the buyer must take the first item they touch.

To see what item the player receives, have both the DM and the player roll a d20. If the DM rolls 1-10, give the player a cursed item matching his roll. If the DM rolls 11-20, give the player a curio matching his roll.
They should not know which type of item they received. Any equipped trinkets cannot be removed.
table.caption: Cursed
rows: The user skin becomes a porcelain white.
Your heart beat is no longer detectable, for all you know it has stopped beating.
The flesh around the ring dies, but remains functional. This effect spreads very slowly.
Your hair turns a silvery white when combed.
After touching the spoon, all food now tastes like hot borscht.
You can now see dark spirits hovering over people who are about to die from age and illness.
Ghosts are now attracted towards your presence when nearby
Your shadow now takes a life of it's own when no-one else is looking.
Womens and girls no longer trust you.
A small shadowfell creature only you can see follows you around.
You can escape into mirrors, but your reflection there will try to kill you.
The more cruel deeds you commit the more your appearance becomes devil like
You gain terrible visions of the future, but unknown to you, they're always wrong.
You start sleep walking, doing bizarre things in the night
You no longer need to eat. If you try to, you immediately vomit.
You gain resistance from cold but vulnerability to fire.
If pinned on one's clothing, it turns their whole outfit monochromatic.
Your character will occasionally be shifted into the distant past or far future for several seconds.
A creepy doll whose eyes follow you. If thrown away it shows up again the next day.

table.name: Dragomir's Grab Bag; Curios
intro: Dragomir has a huge assortment of cursed items and relics. Most of them, however, are fairly mundane and would not do be a great boon or bane to the player. He has been unable to sell these trinkets so tries to get rid of them for a paltry fee. When picking an item out of the bag, the buyer must take the first item they touch.

To see what item the player receives, have both the DM and the player roll a d20. If the DM rolls 1-10, give the player a cursed item matching his roll. If the DM rolls 11-20, give the player a curio matching his roll.
They should not know which type of item they received. Any equipped trinkets cannot be removed.
table.caption: Curios
rows: Your eyes turn to cats eyes. You gain darkvision.
You can sense heartbeats within 30ft, but not their direction.
You can use this needle to stitch on a dead limb to replace one of your own, giving it life.
When angry, your eyes turn blood red, giving +1 to intimidation.
Each round in combat you steal 1 life from any ally or creature within 5ft
You gain 10ft of extra movement in darkness
You have advantage when making arcana checks about necromancy
You can make shadow puppets that come alive, but are always just shadows.
You do double damage to werewolves but they also do double to you.
You can now eat rotten meat and not get sick.
You can sense when undead are beneath your feat.
You can see invisible creatures, but only behind you in the mirror.
Your blood is now poison, if a creature bites you, do 1d4 damage.
Once per day you can become ethereal for 6 seconds.
You critically hit on 19-20. But something extra awful happens on critical miss
Gives you +2 persuasion against women but also attracts wolves.
50% chance of doubling or nullifying any drinks potency.
Bewitches an inanimate object 3 times for day, but they don't obey commands
Summons a skeleton cat familiar. If the cat is destroyed so is the skull.
Summons a swarm of rats (3 charges). 25% chance they turn on their attacker

variantrule.name: Silvered Weapons
entries: Silver weapons hurt certain creatures vulnerable to the metal.

entries.name: Credits
entries: Art and item designed by {@link Shops of Barovia|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-LTK3X6AKprD0KM1RLYC}. Please credit if you repost elsewhere.

variantrule.name: Sacred Oak Weapons
entries: Sacred oak weapons do critical damage on natural rolls of 18-20 when fighting vampires.

entries.name: Credits
entries: Art and item designed by {@link Shops of Barovia|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-LTK3X6AKprD0KM1RLYC}. Please credit if you repost elsewhere.

variantrule.name: Armor Fitting
entries: The chances of finding a set of armor that is one's exact size on a slain enemy is rare. For a nominal fee, a blacksmith will tailor, hammer, and sometimes even modify the armor to fit a customer.
Price: 20gp
Time: 1-3 days

entries.name: Credits
entries: Art and item designed by {@link Shops of Barovia|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-LTK3X6AKprD0KM1RLYC}. Please credit if you repost elsewhere.

variantrule.name: Gilding
entries: The process of decorating a weapon or suit of armor with gemstones or gold, costing 100 gp in addition to material costs. It confers no benefits on the battlefield, but grant's +1 to all persuasion skill checks while wearing it.
{@b Price}: 100gp + Gem/s
{@b Time}: 1 day

entries.name: Credits
entries: Art and item designed by {@link Shops of Barovia|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-LTK3X6AKprD0KM1RLYC}. Please credit if you repost elsewhere.

variantrule.name: Deep Iron Alloy
entries: An incredibly hard metal taken from the Underdark, armor made from this material can withstand the harshest of blows. When getting hit while wearing Deep Iron armor, critical hits will be transformed into regular hits. This process only works on non-magic armor.
{@b Price}: 400gp + Armor
{@b Time}: 3-5 days

entries.name: Credits
entries: Art and item designed by {@link Shops of Barovia|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-LTK3X6AKprD0KM1RLYC}. Please credit if you repost elsewhere.

variantrule.name: Spikes
entries: Fits iron spikes on an armor set. Not only does this create a fearsome appearance, it will inflict damage on any successful grapple equal to the wearer's strength bonus.
{@b Price}: 30gp
{@b Time}: 1 day

entries.name: Credits
entries: Art and item designed by {@link Shops of Barovia|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-LTK3X6AKprD0KM1RLYC}. Please credit if you repost elsewhere.

variantrule.name: Parry
entries: This weapons can parry incoming attacks. If you hold your bonus action during your turn, you are granted an additional +1 to AC when attacked by a melee weapon from a target you can see. Wielding a parrying weapon in each hand allows you to boost your AC twice.

entries.name: Credits
entries: Art and item designed by {@link Shops of Barovia|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-LTK3X6AKprD0KM1RLYC}. Please credit if you repost elsewhere.

variantrule.name: Unweildy
entries: Due to the sheer size and weight of this weapon, it is difficult to wield gracefully. It has a -3 penalty when rolling to hit, but a +3 to damage when landing a blow.

entries.name: Credits
entries: Art and item designed by {@link Shops of Barovia|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-LTK3X6AKprD0KM1RLYC}. Please credit if you repost elsewhere.

variantrule.name: Wind-Up
entries: You can prepare attacks with this weapon to make it even more effective. You can use an action to wind up or set your weapon. On the next attack you make with the weapon you add an additional weapon die to that attack if it hits. A weapon can only add one such damage die in this way. If no attack is made by the end of the wielder's next turn it is no longer wound up. The wielder can use an action to keep the weapon wound up for a subsequent round. A weapon that is wound up can be used to make an opportunity attack when an enemy enters its range.

entries.name: Credits
entries: Art and item designed by {@link Shops of Barovia|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-LTK3X6AKprD0KM1RLYC}. Please credit if you repost elsewhere.

variantrule.name: Repeating Crossbow
entries: Carries the stats of a regular heavy crossbow with the exception that it does not need to reload for 5 consecutive shots.

entries.name: Credits
entries: Art and item designed by {@link Shops of Barovia|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-LTK3X6AKprD0KM1RLYC}. Please credit if you repost elsewhere.
